ygData.msgSnippet: The damage report was not encouraging.  Although its quarry had escaped the energy storm s wrath, Rogue Star had not.  Now most of its crew was in a comatose

The damage report was not encouraging.  Although its quarry had 
escaped the energy storm's wrath, Rogue Star had not.  Now most of 
its crew was in a comatose state, and repairs were sorely needed.  
After examining the situation, the conscious Rogues chose to land on 
the most suitable landmass - the large northern continent.  And so 
the Rogue Star, hidden under its powerful cloaking device, began to 
descend ...

Meanwhile, in the storage room that doubled as her sleeping quarters, 
another transformer was busy moping.  There wasn't much else to do.  
A prisoner by another name, Phoenix hated the Rogues and all that 
they stood for, but was too terrified to do anything about it.  She'd 
been conditioned over the course of nine stellar cycles to cower away 
from them.

Not to mention, she hated violence in any form even more than she 
despised her captors.  Phoenix had no idea where her strong beliefs 
came from, but she knew it had to have something to do with the 
memory engrams the Rogues had destroyed before her eyes, in the 
earliest event she could recall clearly.
